noun.name: fork
noun.discription: a utensil with two or more prongs used for eating or serving food

object1.name: spoon
object1.discription: in parallel with 'fork', is a utensil with a shallow bowl-shaped end and a handle, used for scooping and eating food

object2.name: knife
object2.discription: in parallel with 'fork', is a utensil with a sharp blade and a handle, used for cutting and slicing food

object3.name: chopsticks
object3.discription: in parallel with 'fork', is a pair of slender sticks used as utensils for eating in many Asian cultures

object4.name: spatula
object4.discription: in parallel with 'fork', is a flat, broad-bladed instrument used for mixing, spreading, or lifting food

object5.name: tongs
object5.discription: in parallel with 'fork', is a tool with two arms joined at one end, used for grasping and lifting objects, especially food

object6.name: ladle
object6.discription: in parallel with 'fork', is a large, deep spoon with a long handle, used for serving soup or other liquids

object7.name: whisk
object7.discription: in parallel with 'fork', is a tool with a set of wire loops, used for mixing and beating ingredients together

object8.name: rolling pin
object8.discription: in parallel with 'fork', is a cylindrical tool used to roll out dough or flatten materials
